DataElement.preferredName: Bone Marrow Complete Remission Specimen Most Recent Collection Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date the most recent bone marrow specimen, that molecular complete remission is present, was collected.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bone Marrow Complete Remission Specimen Most Recent Collection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the most recent collection of a bone marrow, the soft tissue filling the cavities of bones, specimen that showed the disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The soft tissue filling the cavities of bones. Bone marrow exists in two types, yellow and red. Yellow marrow is found in the large cavities of large bones and consists mostly of fat cells and a few primitive blood cells. Red marrow is a hematopoietic tissue and is the site of production of erythrocytes and granular leukocytes. Bone marrow is made up of a framework of connective tissue containing branching fibers with the frame being filled with marrow cells (MSH98):The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.  This does not always mean the cancer has been cured.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.
The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Nearest to the present time.:The act of gathering something together.

Concepts.definition: The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
